data.title: Station Information
data.meta_description: Brough station was originally built in 1840. The station has 2 platforms with direct services to Hull, Leeds and Manchester. 7 Hull Trains services stop at Brough every day. The station is situated approximately ½ mile from the town centre making it an easy walk. Brough station is fully staffed with waiting rooms on both platforms. The station has a car park adjacent to the station with over 150 spaces and space available for bikes. Further detail on facilities can be found below as well as information on live times arriving and departing from Brough.

Great Value Train Travel

Brough

Brough station Station Road Brough East Riding of Yorkshire

HU15 1DZ

Brough Station | Station Information | Hull Trains

Brough station was originally built in 1840. The station has 2 platforms with direct services to Hull, Leeds and Manchester. 7 Hull Trains services stop at Brough every day. The station is situated approximately ½ mile from the town centre making it an easy walk. Brough station is fully staffed with waiting rooms on both platforms. The station has a car park adjacent to the station with over 150 spaces and space available for bikes. Further detail on facilities can be found below as well as information on live times arriving and departing from Brough.

Take a virtual 360-degree tour of Brough station here.

STATION DETAILS

Accessible Booking Office Counter

Accessible Ticket Machines

Customer Help Points

Help Points are available on both platforms to contact a member of our team in an emergency or for information when the ticket office is closed. When using the Help Point our CCTV will be monitoring your position for the duration of the call.

Induction Loop

Ramp For Train Access

Staff Help Available

Monday to Friday – 05:15 to 19:45 Saturday – 05:15 to 19:45 Sunday – 09:00 to 18:30

Step Free Access

This station is category A. Ramped access is provided from the station entrance to all platforms. This station is partially staffed. There are train boarding ramps available at this station, and they are also carried on board all TransPennine Express trains.

Wheelchairs Available

This station does not offer

Accessible Public Telephones, Accessible Taxis, Impaired Mobility Set Down, National Key Toilets

Rail Replacement Services

Replacement coaches depart outside the Ferry Inn on Station Road.

Taxi Rank

The nearest taxi office is on the station platform.

Customer Service

To speak to a member of our team, please call: 0345 600 1671.
